Sentence: One day Taylor meets two of Mattie's friends, Estevan and Esperanza, a married couple from Guatemala
The government wanted the names of union members from Estevan and Esperanza and took their daughter, Ismene, as a way of forcing them to tell
On the night of the first summer rain, Mattie takes Esperanza, Estevan, and Taylor into the desert to see the natural world come to life
Turtle's trauma and the difficulties of Estevan and Esperanza make Taylor depressed
Mattie becomes worried about Estevan and Esperanza's safety
Taylor decides she (Esperanza) will transport Estevan and Esperanza to another sanctuary for illegal immigrants in Oklahoma
Taylor, Esperanza, and Estevan decide to go to the Lake o' the Cherokees
During that time, Taylor concocts a plan to convince the authorities in Oklahoma that Estevan and Esperanza are Turtle's biological parents
Armistead, the legal authority in Oklahoma, Esperanza and Estevan pretend to be Turtle's biological parents
Taylor and Turtle drop off Esperanza and Estevan at their new home, a church in Oklahoma
